channel.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News Today: Read the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: How are Nordic countries preparing for potential war amid Russia-Ukraine conflict?
item.description: As the Russia-Ukraine conflict escalates, Nordic countries, including Sweden, Finland, Norway, and Denmark, are proactively preparing their citizens for potential crises. These nations are distributing preparedness guides, launching informative websites, and urging citizens to stockpile essential supplies to enhance national readiness for various threats, including military conflict.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Italian village offers homes at $1 for Americans disappointed by Donald Trump's win
item.description: The Italian village of Ollolai is offering homes for just one euro to attract new residents, particularly Americans disillusioned with recent political events. With a dwindling population, the village hopes to revitalize its economy by welcoming digital nomads and those seeking a change of pace. Mayor Francesco Columbu said they made a website specifically to attract American voters in the wake of the presidential elections.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did Sean 'Diddy' Combs faint in court after allegedly receiving a life sentence? Here’s the truth behind viral video
item.description: A viral video falsely claimed Sean "Diddy" Combs collapsed in court after receiving a life sentence. Combs is awaiting trial on charges of coercion and abuse, with his attorneys seeking bail and prosecutors alleging witness tampering. His trial is scheduled for May 5th.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump picks Cantor Fitzgerald CEO Howard Lutnick as commerce secretary
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump has nominated Howard Lutnick, CEO of Cantor Fitzgerald, for commerce secretary. Lutnick, a longtime Trump supporter, is expected to leverage his Wall Street connections to bolster American manufacturing and potentially cryptocurrency. If confirmed, he would also play a key role in navigating US-China tech competition, particularly regarding semiconductor technology.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Diddy will appear in court without shackles, judge grants special request
item.description: Sean "Diddy" Combs will appear in court unshackled after his lawyer argued that it could prejudice the jury. Diddy's legal team secured an emergency hearing, alleging outrageous government conduct after documents seized during a jail cell raid were used against him. The prosecutors responded and said the raid in Combs' cell was part of a jail-wide safely-related sweep and had nothing to do with Diddy's prosecution specifically.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump aide says calling Elon Musk 'Soros of the Right' was spontaneous, she didn't ask before
item.description: Donald Trump aide Brooke Rollins who asked 'where is the George Soros of the Right?' when Elon Musk raised his hand at a viral moment in Mar-a-Lago said it came from her long quest about why Republicans do not have a Soros or Zuckerberg-like backer. She said it was spontaneous and she could not even see from the stage that Elon Musk reacted to her epithet.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Police shoot and kill Las Vegas man who called 911 to report home invasion; watch video
item.description: A Las Vegas man, Brandon Durham, called 911 during an alleged home invasion and struggle with Alejandra Boudreaux. Responding officer Alexander Bookman shot Durham, who later died. Durham's family demands answers as police investigate the officer's use of force. Boudreaux faces charges including home invasion and assault.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: PTI November 24 power show: Imran Khan tells party members to march or leave
item.description: Imprisoned former Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan urged his party members to join his protest on November 24th, demanding the return of his alleged stolen mandate and his release. He warned that those who don't participate should disassociate from the party.
item.dc:creator: Omer Farooq Khan

item.title: From frosty fields to snowy streets: UK braces for winter chaos brought by Arctic air
item.description: An Arctic air mass sweeping across the UK has brought snow, ice, and sub-zero temperatures, causing widespread disruptions. Around 200 schools were closed, and train services faced delays and cancellations due to snow-covered tracks. Icy roads led to accidents, including a bus overturning in Scotland, though no injuries were reported. The Met Office issued snow and ice warnings, forecasting up to 20 cm of snow in higher areas, while temperatures plunged to -11°C in parts of Scotland. A cold weather health alert warns of risks to vulnerable groups, with potential power cuts and rural isolation adding to the chaos.

item.title: Watch: Passengers scream as Pegasus airlines flight hit by storm in terrifying video
item.description: A Pegasus Airlines flight from Istanbul to Mersin made an emergency landing in Kayseri due to severe weather. The flight experienced intense turbulence, causing panic among passengers. Videos captured the terrifying ordeal, showing the plane shaking violently. Medical teams were present upon landing to assist distressed passengers.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Howard Lutnick likely to be Trump's Commerce secretary. This is not what the megadonor wanted
item.description: Lutnick gained national attention when 658 of his employees and his brother died in the 2001 World Trade Center attack. He rebuilt Cantor Fitzgerald almost from ashes. 63-year-old Lutnick had been in the running to be Treasury secretary but Donald Trump reportedly soured on him due to infighting between Lutnick and other prominent candidates for the job, including financier Scott Bessent.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Unidentified hacker gains access to damaging Matt Gaetz's files. Here's what happened
item.description: Amid controversy over Matt Gaetz selected as Donald Trump's attorney general, a computer file containing damaging information about Gaetz has been hacked. Gaetz is embroiled in an old sex scandal which was probed by the DoJ and no charges were pressed against him. Two women claimed to have been paid for sex by Gaetz and their lawyer is now revealing details against Gaetz.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Nikki Haley calls out 'Morning Joe' hosts for meeting with Trump: 'They saw their ratings'
item.description: Nikki Haley criticized MSNBC's "Morning Joe" hosts Joe Scarborough and Mika Brzezinski for meeting with former President Donald Trump, accusing them of hypocrisy to boost ratings. Haley, a vocal Trump critic, slammed the hosts for their past condemnation of Trump while now seeking dialogue with him after years of harsh criticism.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel says 'JD Vance must be on/in his couch' as Trump enjoys boys' night out
item.description: Jimmy Kimmel poked fun at Donald Trump's recent activities, from his cabinet picks to his 'boys night out' at a UFC event. Kimmel joked about Trump's apparent 'subservience tests' for his cabinet members, highlighting RFK Jr. being made to eat McDonald's. He also pointed out JD Vance's absence from these events wondering what he is up to on/in his couch.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 3 reasons Elon Musk things Matt Gaetz will be the 'Hammer of Justice'
item.description: He wrote: "Matt Gaetz has 3 critical assets that are needed for the AG role: a big brain, a spine of steel and an axe to grind. He is the Judge Dredd America needs to clean up a corrupt system and put powerful bad actors in prison. Gaetz will be our Hammer of Justice. As for these accusations against him, I consider them worth less than nothing. Under our laws, a man is considered innocent until proven guilty. If AG Garland (an unprincipled douchebag) could have secured a conviction against Gaetz, he would have, but he knew he could not."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Norway's Crown Princess's son, Marius Borg Høiby, arrested on rape suspicion
item.description: Marius Borg Høiby, stepson of Norway's Crown Prince Haakon, was arrested in Oslo on suspicion of rape. Police charged him with sexual intercourse with someone unable to consent. Borg Høiby denies the allegations. This incident follows previous legal troubles, including assault and restraining order violations. The Norwegian royal palace has not commented.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hunter Biden enjoys family day at Disneyland ahead of federal sentencing
item.description: Hunter Biden, son of President Joe Biden, recently enjoyed a family outing at Disneyland amidst upcoming sentencing for tax evasion and illegal gun possession. Joined by his wife, son, and friends, Biden appeared in good spirits as he awaits his December court dates.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Sarah McBride is a biological man': The transgender bathroom row rocking the Capitol
item.description: Following the election of Sarah McBride as the first openly transgender member of Congress, Republican Congresswoman Nancy Mace introduced a bill to bar McBride from using bathrooms aligning with her gender identity within the Capitol. Critics, including McBride, argue that such legislation distracts from pressing issues like healthcare and housing. Mace, once considered a moderate, has shifted rightward after redistricting secured her district for Republicans. This controversy highlights the GOP's focus on cultural issues, with figures like Marjorie Taylor Greene supporting similar measures. Democrats face challenges as Republicans leverage transgender rights debates to energize their base post-2024 elections.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did Matt Gaetz have a son before he married Ginger Luckey?
item.description: Embroiled in controversy, Matt Gaetz, a former congressman facing allegations of sex trafficking, is under scrutiny for his relationship with his adopted son, Nestor. Gaetz, who introduced Nestor to the public in 2020, now faces claims that he used Nestor's PayPal account to pay for sex, further deepening the scandal.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Cancer, Prince William, and Prince Andrew: Why King Charles is struggling
item.description: Prince William recently sparked controversy with a public critique of royal leadership. In an interview during his trip to South Africa for the Earthshot Prize, the Prince of Wales outlined his vision for a modernized monarchy focused on impact, philanthropy, and collaboration. While William emphasized doing things differently for his generation, the remarks were interpreted as a thinly veiled criticism of his father's approach to governance. His comments, described by some as throwing King Charles "under the bus," highlight growing rifts within the royal family.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
